citeinfo.title: filename_of_transects - Digital Shoreline Analysis System Version 5.0 Transect Feature Class

idinfo.useconst: These data were automatically generated using the DSAS v5.0 software applications and should only be used for purposes explicitly stated by the originating organization.

citeinfo.title: Digital Shoreline Analysis System (version 5.0): U.S. Geological Survey software

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program
U.S. Geological Survey, Coastal and Marine Geology Program

dataqual.logic: These data were generated using DSAS, an automated software program which does not perform checks for fidelity of the input features. Any testing on these data should be carried out by end-users to ensure fidelity of relationships.
dataqual.complete: This dataset contains all the transects automatically generated by the DSAS software application.

enttyp.enttypd: Transects are automatically generated by DSAS at a 90 degree angle to the user-specified baseline.
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Unique identification number of the baseline segment. If BaselineID=0 no transects will be generated. Used by DSAS to determine transect ordering alongshore if multiple baseline segments exist.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS based on user settings in Default Parameters. Groups are assigned using the following logic: if a user selects a group field as an input parameter (an attribute field in the user-specified baseline feature class), DSAS will populate the transect feature class with the corresponding group ID value of the baseline segment from which the transect is cast; if user does not select a baseline group field as an input parameter, then DSAS assigns a value of zero. The group field is used to segregate large areas into discrete sections when computing advanced change statistics that utilize spatial autocorrelation. Users may change group field values after the transects are automatically generated and before statistics are computed.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS based on ordering of transects along the baseline. Used to allow user to sort transect data sequentially alongshore from the baseline from baseline start to baseline end.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS to indicate whether or not a transect has been modified after generated by DSAS (0= transect was auto generated by DSAS; 1=transect has been edited).
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Assigned by DSAS to to record the azimuth of the transect measure in degrees clockwise from North.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey, Woods Hole Science Center

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal meters.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
